Description: Shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an oinochoe; exterior: neck glazed, band at top of shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of male figure standing (head with beard and part of himation in added red remaining) to right; dots as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 62, no. A36, pl. XLVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.222) (phase 3)
